The group of students had been planning the prank for weeks. They had decided to steal their teacher's favorite mug and then damage it in some way. They had even gone so far as to purchase the mug from a nearby store. 

The night of the prank arrived and the students gathered outside the teacher's house. They crept up to the back door and one of them reached in to unlatch the lock. Once inside, they quickly located the mug and snuck it away. 

The students then began to search for something to use as a weapon. They found a long stick and decided to use it to break the mug. As they were about to strike, they heard a noise coming from the kitchen. The teacher had come home early and the students panicked. 

In the ensuing chaos, the students ran out of the house with the mug still in their possession. As they made their way back to school, they began to worry about what the teacher would do when he found out what they had done. 

The students never did find out what the teacher did in response to their prank. But they never forgot the lesson they learned that night: that no matter how much you plan a prank, you can never be sure of the consequences.
